intro: Minuartia filiorum, commonly known as the "children's rockcress," is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are alternate, linear, and often covered in fine hairs. Minuartia filiorum produces small, yellow or white flowers that bloom in early spring.
